articles.author: Andrius Sytas
articles.description: A DHL cargo plane crashed near Lithuania’s Vilnius airport on Monday at about 0330 GMT, killing one person and injuring two others, airport, police and firefighter officials told Reuters.
articles.title: One dead, two injured in DHL cargo plane crash near Vilnius airport

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: A march by hundreds of supporters to demand the release of jailed former Prime Minister Imran Khan reached the fringes of Pakistan's capital of Islamabad on Monday, his party and officials said, amid reports of violence elsewhere.
articles.title: Marchers demanding release of Pakistan's Imran Khan near capital

articles.author: Devjyot Ghoshal, Poppy Mcpherson
articles.description: Thousands of Rohingya insurgents have emerged from refugee camps in Bangladesh’s Cox's Bazar, where militant recruitment and violence have surged this year, according to people familiar with the conflict and internal aid agency reports seen by Reuters.
articles.title: In world's largest refugee camps, Rohingya mobilise to fight in Myanmar

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The supreme leader of Iran, which backs the Hamas and Hezbollah militants fighting Israel in Gaza and Lebanon, said on Monday that death sentences should be issued for Israeli leaders, not arrest warrants.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei calls for death sentence for Israeli leaders

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Phil Stewart, Josh Smith
articles.description: North Korea is expanding a key weapons manufacturing complex that assembles a type of short-range missile used by Russia in Ukraine, researchers at a U.S.-based think tank have concluded, based on satellite images.
articles.title: Exclusive: Satellite images suggest North Korea expanding missile plant, researchers say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Irish Prime Minister Simon Harris' Fine Gael party has slipped into third place after losing a quarter of its support in less than two weeks, according to one of the final opinion polls before Friday's general election.
articles.title: Irish PM's party slips to third place in pre-election poll

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iraq's population has risen to 45.4 million, according to preliminary results from a national census, Iraqi Prime Minister Mohammed Shia al-Sudani said on Monday.
articles.title: Iraq's population reaches 45.4 million in first census in over 30 years

articles.author: Manuela Andreoni
articles.description: The political fortunes of Brazil's hard-right former President Jair Bolsonaro long mirrored those of his ideological ally Donald Trump - but their fates now look to have diverged dramatically.
articles.title: Bolsonaro sidelined from Brazil's political scene as Trump enjoys resurgence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The prosecution asked on Monday that Dominique Pelicot be sentenced to prison for 20 years for drugging and raping his wife Gisele Pelicot and recruiting dozens of others to rape her for nearly a decade in a case that has shocked the world.
articles.title: Prosecution asks for 20-year sentence for Frenchman accused of drugging, mass rape of wife

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos said on Monday he will not take lightly "troubling" threats against him, just days after his estranged vice president said she had asked someone to assassinate the president if she herself was killed.
articles.title: Philippines Marcos says threat of assassination 'troubling'
